intro: Petalostemon candidus var. multifoliolatus, commonly known as the white petalostemon, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It features showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has a sprawling growth habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often deeply lobed. Its foliage is covered in fine, white pubescence, giving it a distinctive appearance. This species is valued in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
